Gunfire. Laser blasts. Rockets. Detonations. Shouts. Pain. Death.

The Silv=
er Wings Guards had just realized the local Iron Skull
soldiers had taken o=
ver the parliament building, and they had reacted
as they thought was prope=
r.

Most of the Iron Skulls had been loyal or dumb enough to follow
Jotunn'=
s instructions and had not opened fire as soon as the Silver
Wings had show=
ed up. The rest of them had not passed up on the
opportunity and used all t=
hey could to either gets things done and
ensure the building would stay the=
irs, or to satisfy their anger.

No matter, things had slowly started degen=
erating into violence, and
now the Parliament was under siege. Casualties s=
oon increased on both
sides and the Silver Wings started building barricade=
s and installing
a defense grid around the tower. If the Iron Skulls had lo=
cked
themselves in, the Silver Wings were ready to make sure none would
esc=
ape alive.

Of course, a priority one message of the situation had been sen=
t to
Lord Razorwing.
